name: Digital Art
description: Art created using digital tools and techniques

name: Surrealism
description: An artistic movement that seeks to explore the subconscious mind and challenge conventional notions of reality

name: Concept Art
description: Art created to develop and visualize ideas for films, video games, or other media

name: Illustration
description: Visual representation or interpretation of a text or idea

name: Character Design
description: Designing the appearance and personality of fictional characters for use in media

name: Anime
description: A style of animation originating from Japan, characterized by colorful graphics, vibrant characters, and fantastical themes

name: Realism
description: Art that seeks to accurately and realistically depict its subject matter

name: Pop Art
description: An art movement that emerged in the 1950s, characterized by bold colors, recognizable imagery, and an emphasis on popular culture

name: Steampunk
description: A subgenre of science fiction or fantasy that incorporates retro-futuristic technology and aesthetics inspired by 19th-century steam-powered machinery

name: Pixel Art
description: Art that uses a low-resolution raster graphic design, where individual pixels represent the design elements

name: Graffiti Art
description: Art created in public spaces using spray paint or other similar materials

name: Fantasy Art
description: Art that depicts imaginative or fantastical subject matter

name: Futurism
description: An artistic and social movement that originated in Italy in the early 20th century, characterized by an emphasis on the future, technology, and speed

name: Art Deco
description: An influential design style that emerged in the 1920s and 1930s, characterized by geometric shapes, streamlined forms, and a sense of luxury and glamour

name: Minimalism
description: Art that uses a minimal number of design elements, often simple geometric shapes or monochromatic color schemes

name: Street Art
description: Art created in public spaces that often incorporates social and political commentary

name: Hyperrealism
description: An art movement characterized by highly realistic and detailed depictions of everyday objects or scenes.

name: Glitch Art
description: An art form that involves manipulating electronic devices or software to create visual or audio glitches.

name: Photorealism
description: An art movement that aims to reproduce the appearance of a photograph in a painting or other medium.

name: Calligraphy
description: The art of producing decorative handwriting or lettering with a pen or brush.

name: Ink
description: A liquid or paste used for writing or drawing, typically composed of a dye or pigment mixed with a solvent.

name: Woodcut Print
description: A printmaking technique where an image is carved into the surface of a block of wood, leaving the printing parts level with the surface while removing the non-printing parts.

name: Manga
description: A style of Japanese comic books and graphic novels, typically aimed at adults as well as children.

name: Sketch
description: A rough or unfinished drawing or painting, often made to assist in the development of a more detailed work.

name: Drawing
description: The art of making pictures or diagrams by hand, using pencils, pens, or other tools.

name: Doodle
description: A drawing or sketch made while a person's attention is otherwise occupied.

name: Dot Art
description: A technique of painting in which small, distinct dots of color are applied in patterns to form an image.

name: Stipple
description: A technique of drawing or painting in which small dots or specks are used to create an image.

name: Anatomical Drawing
description: A detailed and accurate representation of the human body or parts of the body.

name: Visual Novel
description: A type of video game that features mostly static graphics, often with anime-inspired art styles, and a focus on storytelling and decision-making.

name: Graphic Novel
description: A type of comic book, usually with a longer and more complex storyline and aimed at a more mature audience.

name: Hand-Drawn
description: Art created by hand, using various tools such as pencils, pens, markers, or brushes.

name: Graphite
description: A soft, black mineral used for drawing and writing.

name: Colored Pencil
description: A pencil that contains a colored pigment core, used for drawing and coloring.

name: Pastel Art
description: Art made using pastels, which are sticks of pigmented chalk-like substance.

name: Blackboard
description: A smooth, dark surface used for writing or drawing with chalk.

name: Splatter Paint
description: A painting technique where paint is dripped or splattered onto a surface to create a random pattern.

name: Paper-Marbling
description: A decorative technique where paint is floated on a liquid surface and then transferred to paper or fabric.

name: Logo
description: A symbol or design used to represent a brand or organization.

name: Comic Book
description: A type of book that contains comics, or narrative artwork in the form of sequential panels.

name: Poster
description: A large printed picture or notice used for advertising or decoration.

name: Kirigami
description: A variation of origami that involves cutting paper in addition to folding it.

name: Origami
description: The Japanese art of paper folding, where paper is folded into various shapes and designs without cutting or glue.

name: Frame
description: A structure used to hold or display a picture or artwork.

name: Wall Decal
description: A sticker or design that can be applied to a wall as decoration.

name: Banner
description: A long strip of fabric or paper with a message or design, often used for decoration or as a sign.

name: Papercutting
description: An art form where paper is cut into decorative shapes and designs using scissors or a knife.

name: Ice Carving
description: The process of carving ice into sculptures or decorative designs using specialized tools and techniques.

name: Linocut
description: A printmaking technique where a design is cut into a linoleum block and then printed onto paper or fabric.

name: Wood-Carving
description: The process of carving wood into sculptures or decorative designs using specialized tools and techniques.

name: Light Art
description: An art form that uses light as the medium or as a subject to create sculptures, installations, or projections.

name: Bokeh
description: The aesthetic quality of the blur produced in the out-of-focus parts of an image, often used to create a dreamy or romantic effect.

name: Wildlife Photography
description: The practice of taking photographs of animals in their natural habitats, often requiring specialized equipment and techniques.

name: Portrait
description: A representation of a person, usually a photograph or painting, that focuses on their face and expression.

name: Microscopic
description: Relating to things that are too small to be seen with the naked eye, often studied using microscopes or other magnifying devices.

name: Ultra-Wide Angle
description: A lens or technique that allows for a wider field of view than the human eye, often used in landscape or architectural photography.

name: Depth of Field
description: The distance between the nearest and farthest objects in a photograph that appear acceptably sharp, often used creatively to create focus on a particular subject.

name: Closeup
description: A photograph or image taken at close range, often used to show fine details or textures.

name: Blur Effect
description: A technique used in photography or film where the image is intentionally blurred or out-of-focus to create a specific effect or mood.

name: Lens Flare
description: A visual phenomenon that occurs when a bright light source is near the edge of the frame in a photograph or film, often used creatively for artistic effect.

name: Punk
description: A genre of music that originated in the 1970s characterized by fast-paced.

name: Impressionism
description: A style that emphasizes the use of light and color to capture the fleeting effects of a moment.

name: Expressionism
description: A style that emphasizes the artist's subjective emotional experience and seeks to evoke emotion in the viewer.

name: Cubism
description: A style that emphasizes the use of geometric shapes to represent objects and images.

name: Abstract Expressionism
description: A style that emphasizes the spontaneous, automatic, or subconscious creation of art.

name: Fauvism
description: A style that emphasizes bold, vibrant colors and simplified forms to express emotion and feeling.

name: Art Nouveau
description: A style that emphasizes natural forms, flowing lines, and ornate decoration.

name: Post-Impressionism
description: A style that builds on the foundation of Impressionism, but incorporates more abstract and symbolic elements.

name: Baroque
description: A style that emphasizes drama, movement, and elaborate ornamentation.

name: Rococo
description: A style that emphasizes decorative ornamentation, pastel colors, and a light-hearted, playful attitude.

name: Neoclassicism
description: A style that draws inspiration from classical antiquity, emphasizing order, simplicity, and rationality.

name: Romanticism
description: A style that emphasizes emotion, imagination, nature, and the individual, often associated with the 18th and 19th centuries in Europe.

name: Gothic
description: A style that emphasizes dark, dramatic, and ornate elements, often associated with medieval European architecture and art.

name: Modernism
description: A style that emphasizes innovation, experimentation, and the rejection of traditional values.

name: Postmodernism
description: A style that rejects the concept of a unified or objective truth, emphasizing the subjective experience and cultural diversity.

name: Conceptual Art
description: A style that emphasizes the idea or concept behind the artwork, often employing non-traditional materials or techniques.

name: Abstract
description: A style that emphasizes the use of color, shape, line, and form to create a non-representational or abstract image.

name: Naive Art
description: A style that emphasizes simple, childlike, or unsophisticated imagery, often expressing a sense of innocence or nostalgia.

name: Trompe-l'oeil
description: A style that emphasizes realistic illusionism, often creating the impression of three-dimensional objects or space on a two-dimensional surface.
